description: Runs a SQL statement against a database.

parameters.name: resourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Aurora Serverless DB cluster.

parameters.name: secretArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the secret that enables access to the DB cluster. Enter the database user name and password for the credentials in the secret. For information about creating the secret, see Create a database secret.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: The name of the database schema.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the SQL statement. (dict) --- A parameter used in a SQL statement. name (string) --- The name of the parameter. value (dict) --- The value of the parameter. isNull (boolean) --- A NULL value. booleanValue (boolean) --- A value of Boolean data type. longValue (integer) --- A value of long data type. doubleValue (float) --- A value of double data type. stringValue (string) --- A value of string data type. blobValue (bytes) --- A value of BLOB data type. arrayValue (dict) --- An array of values. booleanValues (list) --- An array of Boolean values. (boolean) --- longValues (list) --- An array of integers. (integer) --- doubleValues (list) --- An array of floating-point numbers. (float) --- stringValues (list) --- An array of strings. (string) --- arrayValues (list) --- An array of arrays. (dict) --- Contains an array. typeHint (string) --- A hint that specifies the correct object type for data type mapping. Possible values are as follows: DATE - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of DATE type to the database. The accepted format is YYYY-MM-DD. DECIMAL - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of DECIMAL type to the database. JSON - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of JSON type to the database. TIME - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of TIME type to the database. The accepted format is HH:MM:SS[.FFF]. TIMESTAMP - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of TIMESTAMP type to the database. The accepted format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.FFF]. UUID - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of UUID type to the database.

nested_params.name: booleanValue
nested_params.description: A value of Boolean data type.

nested_params.name: longValue
nested_params.description: A value of long data type.

nested_params.name: doubleValue
nested_params.description: A value of double data type.

nested_params.name: stringValue
nested_params.description: A value of string data type.

nested_params.name: blobValue
nested_params.description: A value of BLOB data type.

nested_params.name: typeHint
nested_params.description: A hint that specifies the correct object type for data type mapping. Possible values are as follows:

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The identifier of a transaction that was started by using the BeginTransaction operation. Specify the transaction ID of the transaction that you want to include the SQL statement in. If the SQL statement is not part of a transaction, don't set this parameter.

parameters.name: continueAfterTimeout
parameters.description: A value that indicates whether to continue running the statement after the call times out. By default, the statement stops running when the call times out.

parameters.name: resultSetOptions
parameters.description: Options that control how the result set is returned. decimalReturnType (string) --- A value that indicates how a field of DECIMAL type is represented in the response. The value of STRING, the default, specifies that it is converted to a String value. The value of DOUBLE_OR_LONG specifies that it is converted to a Long value if its scale is 0, or to a Double value otherwise. longReturnType (string) --- A value that indicates how a field of LONG type is represented. Allowed values are LONG and STRING. The default is LONG. Specify STRING if the length or precision of numeric values might cause truncation or rounding errors.

nested_params.name: decimalReturnType
nested_params.description: A value that indicates how a field of DECIMAL type is represented in the response. The value of STRING, the default, specifies that it is converted to a String value. The value of DOUBLE_OR_LONG specifies that it is converted to a Long value if its scale is 0, or to a Double value otherwise.

nested_params.name: longReturnType
nested_params.description: A value that indicates how a field of LONG type is represented. Allowed values are LONG and STRING. The default is LONG. Specify STRING if the length or precision of numeric values might cause truncation or rounding errors.

parameters.name: formatRecordsAs
parameters.description: A value that indicates whether to format the result set as a single JSON string. This parameter only applies to SELECT statements and is ignored for other types of statements. Allowed values are NONE and JSON. The default value is NONE. The result is returned in the formattedRecords field. For usage information about the JSON format for result sets, see Using the Data API in the Amazon Aurora User Guide.

nested_items.name: records
nested_items.description: The records returned by the SQL statement. This field is blank if the formatRecordsAs parameter is set to JSON.

nested_items.name: booleanValue
nested_items.description: A value of Boolean data type.

nested_items.name: longValue
nested_items.description: A value of long data type.

nested_items.name: doubleValue
nested_items.description: A value of double data type.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: A value of string data type.

nested_items.name: blobValue
nested_items.description: A value of BLOB data type.

nested_items.name: columnMetadata
nested_items.description: Metadata for the columns included in the results. This field is blank if the formatRecordsAs parameter is set to JSON.

nested_items.name: typeName
nested_items.description: The database-specific data type of the column.

nested_items.name: schemaName
nested_items.description: The name of the schema that owns the table that includes the column.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table that includes the column.

nested_items.name: isAutoIncrement
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the column increments automatically.

nested_items.name: isSigned
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether an integer column is signed.

nested_items.name: isCurrency
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the column contains currency values.

nested_items.name: isCaseSensitive
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the column is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: nullable
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the column is nullable.

nested_items.name: precision
nested_items.description: The precision value of a decimal number column.

nested_items.name: scale
nested_items.description: The scale value of a decimal number column.

nested_items.name: numberOfRecordsUpdated
nested_items.description: The number of records updated by the request.

nested_items.name: generatedFields
nested_items.description: Values for fields generated during a DML request.

nested_items.name: booleanValue
nested_items.description: A value of Boolean data type.

nested_items.name: longValue
nested_items.description: A value of long data type.

nested_items.name: doubleValue
nested_items.description: A value of double data type.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: A value of string data type.

nested_items.name: blobValue
nested_items.description: A value of BLOB data type.

nested_items.name: formattedRecords
nested_items.description: A string value that represents the result set of a SELECT statement in JSON format. This value is only present when the formatRecordsAs parameter is set to JSON.
